intro: Omphalodes verna subsp. graeca, commonly known as Greek spring beauty, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a low-growing perennial herb with hairy stems and small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically reaches a height of 10–30 cm and has lance-shaped leaves with a hairy underside. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or dry habitats. Its flowers are pollinated primarily by bees and other insects, contributing to its ecological significance in its native range.
